work.name: Medallion
work.summary: Developed performant, automation-centric product initiatives as a full-stack engineer utilizing Django, React, and GraphQL at a fast moving health-tech startup.
highlights: Pioneered GraphQL at Medallion by handling the initial integration, migrating inefficient REST endpoints, and cultivating an active community - improving app performance, code architecture, and development velocity.
Built a robust email notification system for our high-throughput provider import pipeline using Celery and Customer.io - decreasing turn around times by 30%.
Integrated a battle-tested verifications service using Celerybeat and Pusher into the credentialing platform, ensuring real-time provider compliance while streamlining operational efficiency.

work.name: American Express
work.summary: Developed site/infrastructure related features and enhancements as a full stack engineer on Amex's GCS Commercial team using React, Redux, and GraphQL - making a combined impact of several hundred million dollars annually.
highlights: Executed multiple successful A/B tests, notably creating an enhanced mobile horizontal carousel that projected an annual incremental revenue boost of $150M.
Spearheaded site-wide accessibility enhancements by cataloging outstanding violations while working closely with PMs and developers to reduce the number of issues by over 95%.
Created and popularized an internal Chrome extension to automate syncing authentication cookies between local and test environments - improving developer experience and cutting workflow times by 90%.

work.name: American Express
work.summary: Created Experience Builder - a tool that empowers non-engineers to generate production ready UI variations for consumer facing sites.
highlights: Designed a “composer” UI using React.js featuring an interactive canvas, sortable layer tree, widget palette, and export panel, making it intuitive to create components compliant with standardized design guidelines.
Engineered a persistence and versioning system that allowed multiple users to collaborate concurrently on a composition using PostgreSQL and Express.js.

work.name: Heat.wav
work.summary: Led technical development of a location-based music & artist discovery platform that placed in the quarter finals at NYU InnoVention, and semi finals at RU Innovators.
highlights: Designed and architected Heat.wav's tech stack to fit current and anticipated product needs while setting technical standards to ensure a maintainable codebase.

Collaborated closely with our designer, product expert, and co-developers to effectively translate and delegate feature requests and wireframes into detailed objectives using Asana, Invision, and Slack.
